description: a(1) = 1; a(n+1) is next smallest nontrivial square beginning with a(n).
comments: Next terms are 176, 351 and 702 digits long.
links: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..11
mathematica: $MaxExtraPrecision = 2^10; a[n_] := a[n] = Block[{k = 10, m = a[n - 1]}, id = IntegerDigits@ m; lng = Length@ id; While[c = Ceiling[ Sqrt[ m*k]]^2; Take[ IntegerDigits@ c, lng] != id, k *= 100]; Min[c, (Sqrt[m]*10^(lng/2) + 1)^2]]; a[1] = 1; Array[a, 11] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 18 2014 *)
crossrefs: Cf. A048558, A050628. See A061110 for the square roots.
author: _Patrick De Geest_, May 15 1999
